ETYMOLOGY: From Old English þridda (later þirdda), from Proto-Germanic *þridjô, from Proto-Indo-European *trei-t-yo- (derived from *trey- 'three').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An ordinal number indicates position in a sequence (e.g., first, second, third). An adjective modifies a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Coming after the second in a sequence; 3rd.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 顺序上排在第二之后的；第三的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: This is my third attempt to fix the computer.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这是我第三次尝试修理电脑。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: One of three equal parts of something; 1/3.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: A third of the population lives in rural areas.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 三分之一的人口居住在农村地区。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The person or thing that is third in a sequence or category.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在顺序或类别中排第三的人或事物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was the third to arrive at the party.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她是第三个到达聚会的人。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A musical interval spanning three diatonic scale degrees (e.g., C to E).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个包含三个全音阶音级的音程（例如，从C到E）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The melody features a prominent major third.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这首旋律中有一个突出的大三度音程。
